data.text: Looking for a Full Size Handlebar Bag Alternative to Restrap

Looking for full size bar bag to go camping lets see your recommendations. Dont need 50 people telling me to buy restrap just cos theyre about ¬£200.Would rather pay more for a bag that does what it should rather than a brand.Tia

Planet X . Not the biggest bag but for the price it's spot on ! I've had mine 3 years and still perfect ! Just upgraded to Alpkit as I needed a bigger bag ( 20lt ) . Very good prices and no need to rob a bank üè¶ or re- mortgage !! Hope you get what you need ! Enjoy üëç

data.text: Another vote for planet X. I can fit my sleeping bag, mat, pillow and down jacket into my bar barrel bag

data.text: I've been really struggling to find something to get my 3 season sleeping bag onto my bars. Tried an alpkit airlock 20 (convinced its only about 15L though) with the joey harness, but was too small and the harness wasn't supportive enough. Since got a 25L drybag and the alpkit kanga... plenty of storage.

data.text: I got a cheapish Rockbros one from AliExpress, it's huge and pretty heavy. Also have a Roswheel one which is very similar to the PX one. Quite a bit smaller, still cheap of course

data.text: 2 cheap handlebar extenders from Amazon at around ¬£12 each. I'll fit between them either my roll mat or dry bag. Couple of bungees or luggage straps and it's secure üëç Lasted over a year and never had an issue.

data.text: +1 for toepeak. Was after a decent bar bag with a harness. After looking at loads settled on the toepeak one. Decent price. Rock solid when set up. Doesn't nip the cables. Quick release and takes a variety of bags (plus you get one with it) Just put something on to protect the headstock from one of the straps.
